New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers have become the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers rallied from a 15-point deficit in the second quarter to win 105-100.
Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter to put the Cavaliers ahead for good.
Evan Mobley took the message to heart, making 10 of 11 field goal attempts.
Pre-Game Insights: New coach Kenny Atkinson admitted “there was a little extra” at stake for him facing Brooklyn for the first time since being fired by the Nets in 2020.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers are two victories from matching the longest streak in franchise history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak of doing so in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
Hall of Fame center Wilt Chamberlain and the 1960-61 Philadelphia Warriors had held the mark with nine.
